definitions.definition: A device used to slow or stop the motion of a wheel , or of a vehicle , usually by friction (although other resistive forces, such as electromagnetic fields or aerodynamic drag , can also be used); also, the controls or apparatus used to engage such a mechanism such as the pedal in a car. [from 18th c.]
examples: She slammed the brakes when she saw a child run in front of the car.
You’re pressing the brakes too hard—try just squeezing them.

subdefinitions.definition: The act of braking, of using a brake to slow down a machine or vehicle
examples: Give the car a quick brake .

subdefinitions.definition: ( engineering ) An apparatus for testing the power of a steam engine or other motor by weighing the amount of friction that the motor will overcome; a friction brake .
( figuratively ) Something used to retard or stop some action, process etc.

definitions.definition: ( military ) An ancient engine of war analogous to the crossbow and ballista .

subdefinitions.definition: ( obsolete ) The winch of a crossbow. [14th–19th c.]

definitions.definition: ( chiefly nautical ) The handle of a pump .
A device used to confine or prevent the motion of an animal.

subdefinitions.definition: A frame for confining a refractory horse while the smith is shoeing it.
An enclosure to restrain cattle, horses, etc.
A cart or carriage without a body, used in breaking in horses.
A carriage for transporting shooting parties and their equipment.

definitions.definition: That part of a carriage, as of a movable battery, or engine, which enables it to turn.

main_definition: A device used to slow or stop the motion of a wheel , or of a vehicle , usually by friction (although other resistive forces, such as electromagnetic fields or aerodynamic drag , can also be used); also, the controls or apparatus used to engage such a mechanism such as the pedal in a car. [from 18th c.]
secondary_definitions: ( military ) An ancient engine of war analogous to the crossbow and ballista .
( chiefly nautical ) The handle of a pump .
A device used to confine or prevent the motion of an animal.
That part of a carriage, as of a movable battery, or engine, which enables it to turn.

subdefinitions.definition: Any fern in the genus Pteris .

definitions.definition: A thicket , or an area overgrown with briers etc. [from 15th c.]

main_definition: A thicket , or an area overgrown with briers etc. [from 15th c.]

definitions.definition: A type of machine for bending sheet metal . (See wikipedia .)
( agriculture ) A large , heavy harrow for breaking clods of earth after ploughing ; a drag .
( textiles ) A tool used for breaking flax or hemp . [from 15th c.]

main_definition: A type of machine for bending sheet metal . (See wikipedia .)
secondary_definitions: ( agriculture ) A large , heavy harrow for breaking clods of earth after ploughing ; a drag .
( textiles ) A tool used for breaking flax or hemp . [from 15th c.]
( now historical ) A type of torture instrument. [from 16th c.]
